pull.title: build: Copy appropriate MSVC build output to src/qt automatically
pull.body:
This functionality is already present for non-qt output since #16308, and it was skipped to add in #15529.

Not finding `bitcoin-qt.exe` and `test_bitcoin-qt.exe` in the `src\qt\` folder could confuse users.

This PR fixes that issue in the same way like #16308 did.

verification.payload:
tree e439d1c1ed19e26c36419518cf09c5b181296667
parent 5e3380b9f59481fc18e05b9d651c3c733abe4053
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1631094153 +0300
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1631094245 +0300

build: Copy appropriate MSVC build output to src/qt automatically

This functionality is already present for non-qt output since #16308.

events.message:
build: Copy appropriate MSVC build output to src/qt automatically

This functionality is already present for non-qt output since #16308.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
+<Project xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
+<PropertyGroup><BuildDependsOn>$(BuildDependsOn);CopyBuildArtifacts</BuildDependsOn></PropertyGroup>
+  <Target Name="CopyBuildArtifacts" Condition="'$(ConfigurationType)' != 'StaticLibrary'">
+    <ItemGroup>
+      <BuildArtifacts Include="$(OutDir)$(TargetName)$(TargetExt)"></BuildArtifacts>
+      <BuildArtifacts Include="$(OutDir)$(TargetName).pdb" Condition="Exists('$(OutDir)$(TargetName).pdb')"></BuildArtifacts>
+    </ItemGroup>
+    <Copy SourceFiles="@(BuildArtifacts)" SkipUnchangedFiles="true" DestinationFolder="..\..\src\qt\" Condition="'$(OutDir)' != ''"></Copy>
+  </Target>
+  <Import Project="common.qt.vcxproj.user" Condition="Exists('common.qt.vcxproj.user')" />
+</Project>
comments.body: Do the Qt exe's need to be copied to src\qt for any paricular reason? Is that where the test scripts look for them? I believe Nicolas originally added the `common.vcxproj` config to copy the exe's to the src directory for conveniece. Perhaps it's sufficient here as well and avoids the need for the new `common.qt.vcxproj` file?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
+<Project xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
+<PropertyGroup><BuildDependsOn>$(BuildDependsOn);CopyBuildArtifacts</BuildDependsOn></PropertyGroup>
+  <Target Name="CopyBuildArtifacts" Condition="'$(ConfigurationType)' != 'StaticLibrary'">
+    <ItemGroup>
+      <BuildArtifacts Include="$(OutDir)$(TargetName)$(TargetExt)"></BuildArtifacts>
+      <BuildArtifacts Include="$(OutDir)$(TargetName).pdb" Condition="Exists('$(OutDir)$(TargetName).pdb')"></BuildArtifacts>
+    </ItemGroup>
+    <Copy SourceFiles="@(BuildArtifacts)" SkipUnchangedFiles="true" DestinationFolder="..\..\src\qt\" Condition="'$(OutDir)' != ''"></Copy>
+  </Target>
+  <Import Project="common.qt.vcxproj.user" Condition="Exists('common.qt.vcxproj.user')" />
+</Project>
comments.body:
No test script uses `bitcoin-qt.exe`. The only reason is my confusion:

> Not finding `bitcoin-qt.exe` ... in the `src\qt\` folder could confuse users.

Probably, it is just my biased personal opinion.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
+<Project xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
+<PropertyGroup><BuildDependsOn>$(BuildDependsOn);CopyBuildArtifacts</BuildDependsOn></PropertyGroup>
+  <Target Name="CopyBuildArtifacts" Condition="'$(ConfigurationType)' != 'StaticLibrary'">
+    <ItemGroup>
+      <BuildArtifacts Include="$(OutDir)$(TargetName)$(TargetExt)"></BuildArtifacts>
+      <BuildArtifacts Include="$(OutDir)$(TargetName).pdb" Condition="Exists('$(OutDir)$(TargetName).pdb')"></BuildArtifacts>
+    </ItemGroup>
+    <Copy SourceFiles="@(BuildArtifacts)" SkipUnchangedFiles="true" DestinationFolder="..\..\src\qt\" Condition="'$(OutDir)' != ''"></Copy>
+  </Target>
+  <Import Project="common.qt.vcxproj.user" Condition="Exists('common.qt.vcxproj.user')" />
+</Project>
comments.body: If the test scripts don't need it in `src\qt` then I would recommend just including `common.vcxproj` and not bothering with the new `common.qt.vcxproj` file. Windows devs will normally look in the default output directory of `build_msvc\x64\Release` directory.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@

+<Project xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">

comments.body:
> Windows devs will normally look in the default output directory of `build_msvc\x64\Release` directory.

Agree. Going to close this.
